alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:50AM MST until January 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Localized snow squalls are possible along the Interstate 80 corridor this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Central Carbon County, North Snowy Range Foothills, Southwest Carbon County, Upper North Platte River Basin and Laramie Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
